word_mean: 神志清醒而喃喃自语，见人语止，精神障碍的表现。

sentence.Network_en: Mrs Hall had very reluctantly to leave the rest of his soliloquy.
sentence.Network_cn: 霍尔太太只得怏怏地离开了他,让他一个人去自言自语.

sentence.Network_en: As he made this dreary soliloquy, he had cantered out of Rotten Row into the park.
sentence.Network_cn: 他一边这么闷闷不乐地自言自语,一边离开了罗登道,来到公园里.

sentence.Network_en: Hamlet's soliloquy is probably the most famous in English drama.
sentence.Network_cn: 哈姆雷特的独白在英国戏剧中大概是最出名的了.

英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... interlocution n 对话 soliloquy n 独白，自言自语 somniloquy n 梦话.

戏剧开场角色的说白 [soliloquy speak] 外扮老夫人上开。--元·王实甫《西厢记》 释放;赦免 [release]。如:开释(赦免,释放);开放(开脱;释放)  解除,免去.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from late Latin soliloquium, from Latin solus 'alone' + loqui 'speak'

entry.def: A soliloquy is a speech in a play in which an actor or actress speaks to himself or herself and to the audience, rather than to another actor.

means.word_mean: 2. a (usually long) dramatic speech intended to give the illusion of unspoken reflections

auth_sentence.content: Joyner turned this soliloquy into a blog post.
